item.title: User-friendly software for simulation modeling of infectious diseases
item.description: These are slides for a talk I gave to a group of undergraduate students as part of a First Year Odyssey Seminar class. I provide a very brief introduction to infectious disease modeling and show the DSAIDE software and a worked example. The presentation slides are here.

item.title: DSAIRM - Dynamical Systems Approach to Immune Response Modeling
item.description: We developed an R package that provides immunologists and other bench scientists a user-friendly introduction to dynamical modeling of within-host infection, without the need to write computer code. Learn more about it on the package website.

item.title: DSAIDE - Dynamical Systems Approach to Infectious Disease Epidemiology
item.description: We developed an R package that teaches a modern, model-based approach to infectious disease epidemiolgy without the need to write computer code. Learn more about it on the package website.
